title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 August 2014 - XWiki

01:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> Hi guys, I have a problem about my history section of the page not loading; It loads on the main/webhome but nowhere else and I'm unsure why.. I am running tomcat and XWiki 6.0  
01:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> Any help would be appreciated

11:02 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: your change of yesterday doesn't seem to work: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-index-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.index.test.ui/AllDocsTest/tableViewTabActions/  
11:02 <vmassol> org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException: Unable to locate element: {"method":"xpath","selector":"//li[@id='tmUser']//a[contains(@class, 'dropdown-toggle')]"}  
11:03 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I'm wsorking on it  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> packager plugin was still using colibri  
11:04 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> so when I have fixed some page-objects for xwiki-enterprise-tests, I have broken tests of platform!  
11:11 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: just committed a small improvement for AllDocs  
11:11 <vmassol> (alldocs test)  
11:12 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <gdelhumeau> ok thanks  
11:14 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I am fixing the logout issue actually  
11:14 <vmassol> yes it's needed  
11:14 <vmassol> but not for this test  
11:14 <gdelhumeau> I have created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10821  
11:14 <gdelhumeau> ok  
11:14 <vmassol> there's a log in/log out test anyway  
11:15 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: do you need me to commit sans fixes I have made in page objects?  
11:15 <gdelhumeau> \*some  
11:15 <vmassol> wdym?  
11:16 <gdelhumeau> I have some fixes, but my work is not finished  
11:16 <gdelhumeau> but it can help you ro work on it in //  
11:16 <vmassol> nothing is blocking me  
11:16 <vmassol> ATM  
11:16 <vmassol> thanks  
11:16 <gdelhumeau> good  
11:22 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <woshilapin> Hi acotiuga  
11:23 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: working on panels  
11:23 <gdelhumeau> (tests)  
11:23 <vmassol> k  
11:23 <vmassol> so the tests found a real bug it seems: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/340a700f4a7c31d20331ea5365cc072ba45efd06  
11:23 <vmassol> :)  
11:23 <gdelhumeau> AllDoc is all fixed here  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> indeed :)  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I do no even try a JAR on my webapp without writing unit tests first  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> at the end it makes me save time :)  
11:24 <vmassol> yes  
11:25 <gdelhumeau> next step: write the test before the implem...  
11:26 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I have a fix that should resolve all other tests from platform  
11:27 <gdelhumeau> at least the asserts that are complaining  
11:29 <gdelhumeau> so you should not work on platfrom for now  
11:30 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: cool  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I am testing IRCBot, but in the generated XWiki, IRC.IRCBot does not even exists  
11:42 <vmassol> it does exist: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-ircbot/xwiki-platform-ircbot-ui/src/main/resources/IRC/IRCBot.xml  
11:42 <gdelhumeau> yes of course  
11:43 <gdelhumeau> but I don't why, I cannot find it in the generated XWiki  
11:43 <gdelhumeau> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/IRCBot says that the page does not exists  
11:44 <vmassol> finihsing something first and then I can have a look too if you need help  
11:44 <gdelhumeau> same pb with panels, there is no content anywhere  
11:44 <gdelhumeau> maybe I have broken the packager plugin  
11:44 <vmassol> or sergiu did  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> but it works for AllDocs... strange  
11:45 <vmassol> sergiu modified it yesterday night  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> hmm yes  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> it is a problem since I have pulled the commits  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> I'm looking  
11:45 <vmassol> could you try reverting his chages and test quickly?  
11:46 <vmassol> you can revert just this one: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/409d593cb74a3889bdcfd40d70493a1d83f04c5e#diff-0  
11:47 <gdelhumeau> let me see  
11:47 <acotiuga> has quit  
11:47 <gdelhumeau> it creates conflicts  
11:51 <gdelhumeau> I have checkouted the last commit before the sergui's one  
11:51 <gdelhumeau> I have put my modifications  
11:51 <gdelhumeau> rebuild the packager plugin  
11:51 <gdelhumeau> but it still does not work  
11:51 <gdelhumeau> so I think it is not related to sergiu  
11:51 <gdelhumeau> I'll testing without my changes  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> \*test  
11:53 <vmassol> testing master on my side  
11:53 <gdelhumeau> oh no  
11:53 <gdelhumeau> when some tests fails, xwiki continues to run  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> 11:56:13.382 [main] INFO  o.x.test.integration.XWikiExecutor - XWiki server is already started!  
11:56 <gdelhumeau> but I don't have any wiki running on port 8080  
11:57 <gdelhumeau> actually, there is one, but I do not have started it  
11:59 <gdelhumeau> I have killed the process  
11:59 <gdelhumeau> so I have the same problem than in jenkins agents  
11:59 <vmassol> cool  
11:59 <gdelhumeau> ok then it works when I revert the sergui's work  
12:00 <vmassol> ok I was worried about his changes already  
12:00 <vmassol> coudl you revert his commits and reopen the issue?  
12:01 <gdelhumeau> ok  
12:01 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
12:01 <Lyes2> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <vmassol> tesitng locally  
12:02 <vmassol> hmm  
12:02 <Lyes1> has quit  
12:03 <vmassol> wait  
12:03 <vmassol> works for me  
12:03 <vmassol> I do have http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/IRCBot  
12:03 <vmassol> I rebuilt the packager plugin and rebuilt ircbot  
12:06 <vmassol> (gdelhumeau)  
12:06 <vmassol> wait  
12:06 <vmassol> maybe I forgot tp pull ;)  
12:07 <vmassol> hmm no  
12:08 <vmassol> so it works for me gdelhumeau  
12:08 <vmassol> (I still don't like sergiu's changes but that's another matter)  
12:09 <gdelhumeau> well then it comes from me  
12:09 <gdelhumeau> but I have added some JARs dependencies, that's all  
12:09 <vmassol> just remove your change  
12:09 <vmassol> keep sergiu's  
12:09 <vmassol> rebuild  
12:09 <vmassol> rebuild ircbot  
12:10 <vmassol> go in target/xwiki  
12:10 <vmassol> start it  
12:10 <vmassol> check that http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/IRCBot exists  
12:11 <gdelhumeau> hmm  maybe it was only the fact that I had a ghost wiki running  
12:16 <gdelhumeau> it seems that it is ok for me too now  
12:16 <gdelhumeau> the problem was: I had a ghost wiki somewhere  
12:37 <gdelhumeau> 12:37:07.691 [main] INFO  o.x.test.integration.XWikiExecutor - Checking if an XWiki server is already started at [http://localhost:8080]  
12:37 <gdelhumeau> maybe we could add an option to skip this step  
12:37 <gdelhumeau> and save 10sec each time  
12:40 <vmassol> that's not correcet  
12:40 <vmassol> this step takes less than 100ms  
12:40 <vmassol> I think you're mixing xwiki's startup time  
12:40 <vmassol> with the check  
12:40 <vmassol> you can check the code that does the check to convince yourself :)  
12:41 <gdelhumeau> ok  
12:41 <ClemensR> I found it quite convenient to have the test server running all the time while debugging tests -it often actually saves time :)  
12:48 <sburjan> has quit  
12:52 <gdelhumeau> 12:52:17.042 [main] INFO  o.x.test.integration.XWikiExecutor - Checking if an XWiki server is already started at [http://localhost:8080]  
12:52 <gdelhumeau> 12:52:32.099 [main] INFO  o.x.test.integration.XWikiExecutor - No server is responding on [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/get/Main/] after [15] seconds  
12:53 <gdelhumeau> ?  
12:57 <vmassol> hmmm  
13:00 <vmassol> I thought you meant waitForXWikiToLoad() before but indeed here it seems we have a timeout of 15 seconds to check if xwiki is already started or not befire starting it  
13:02 <ClemensR> a property somewhat opposite to "xwiki.test.skipStart" might help  
13:02 <vmassol> we could indeed change the algorithm  
13:02 <vmassol> especially that new there's xwiki.test.skipStart  
13:02 <vmassol> s/new/now  
13:02 <vmassol> so we could decide that if xwiki.test.skipStart is not set then we want always start xwiki  
13:03 <ClemensR> ah, yes, that should work, too  
13:04 <vmassol> hmm atually not  
13:04 <vmassol> we need the opposite to make it simple to run tests from IDEs  
13:04 <vmassol> have the check by default  
13:04 <vmassol> and set the system property in pom.xml  
13:04 <vmassol> for the maven build  
13:04 <vmassol> so that the maven build doesn't do the check  
13:04 <ClemensR> ah, the IDE assumes there is a wiki server already running ?  
13:05 <vmassol> hmm you're right it doesn't  
13:05 <vmassol> still  
13:05 <vmassol> that would work  
13:05 <vmassol> if you're running from the IDE you don't use maven  
13:05 <vmassol> so you get teh check  
13:06 <vmassol> if a wiki is up it's used  
13:06 <vmassol> if it's not then it's started  
13:06 <vmassol> and from maven you always start it (no check)  
13:07 <vmassol> actually  
13:07 <vmassol> s/actually//  
13:30 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:44 <Denis> has quit  
14:01 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <Slashman> has quit  
14:06 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, is there an easy way how to add checkstyle test to components pom.xml (outside xwiki-platform)?  
14:49 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: sure  
14:49 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/master/xwiki-commons-core/pom.xml#L91  
14:49 <vmassol> (L91 till 96)  
14:50 <vmassol> s/96/95  
14:53 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: thanks, but then i need to have some master pom with checkstyle definition, right?  
14:53 <vmassol> you need to read up on the macen checsktyle plugin  
14:53 <vmassol> http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-checkstyle-plugin/  
14:53 <vmassol> if you use it like I've shwn you'll inheirt from the xwiki definitions defined in the top level pom  
14:53 <vmassol> (commons top level pom)  
14:54 <vmassol> if you want somerthing else you need to read on ht elink I've pasted and understand how to configure the plugin  
14:54 <DarkKnightCZ> oh, i'm missing parent pom definition  
14:58 <Denis> has quit  
15:01 <DarkKnightCZ> thanks, it works

16:02 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <vmassol> Enygma`: I see a lot of the following in my build logs:  
16:09 <vmassol> 16:08:10.116 [Thread-2] ERROR o.x.t.i.XWikiLogOutputStream - 2014-08-20 16:08:10,116 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/TestPage] WARN  o.x.v.i.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Deprecated usage of method [org.apache.velocity.tools.generic.ListTool.get] in @101,40  
16:09 <vmassol> is that caused by the velocity tool upgrade to 2.0?  
16:09 <vmassol> is ListTool deprecated now in 2.0?  
16:09 <vmassol> what's the replacement?  
16:09 <vmassol> (didn't check)  
16:11 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Pong  
16:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: false alert  
16:11 <sdumitriu> Saw that  
16:11 <vmassol> still I'm unsure about your changes but time will tell  
16:11 <vmassol> (if it's good or not)  
16:11 <vmassol> AFAIR I removed what you did a while ago  
16:11 <vmassol> because that wasn't the good way of doing it anymore  
16:12 <vmassol> but I'm not 100% sure, just 70% ;)  
16:12 <sdumitriu> Looked at a bunch of other Maven plugins  
16:12 <vmassol> btw what was failing for you?  
16:12 <sdumitriu> Only maven-shared uses that class  
16:12 <vmassol> because if the problem is just maven 3.1.1 it's not a big deal  
16:12 <sdumitriu> Building with Maven 3.1 or 3.2 fails with class not found org.sonatype.aether  
16:12 <sdumitriu> Which is normal  
16:13 <vmassol> I googled for days  
16:13 <vmassol> before finding the "good way"  
16:13 <sdumitriu> It wa renamed to org.eclipse.aether  
16:13 <vmassol> there are very few instructions  
16:13 <vmassol> yes we need to move to aether  
16:13 <vmassol> I don't understand  
16:13 <sdumitriu> Well, I found an even better way, but the change was bigger  
16:13 <vmassol> I'm on 3.2  
16:13 <vmassol> and it works  
16:13 <vmassol> and the CI works too (not sure what version it uses though)  
16:13 <sdumitriu> Use the dependency-tree module  
16:14 <vmassol> ah it's only some mojo failing?  
16:14 <vmassol> will retry later on with this new information, thanks  
16:14 <vmassol> (on something else ATM)  
16:15 <sdumitriu> No, "use dependency-tree" was the better solution  
16:15 <sdumitriu> The packager plugin fails on Maven 3.1+  
16:15 <sdumitriu> Always  
16:16 <sdumitriu> It cannot work unless you have a modified Maven instance  
16:16 <sdumitriu> Or you're running Maven 3.0 without knowing  
16:16 <sdumitriu> For years we've had a big warning that XWiki only builds with Maven 3.0.x  
16:18 <vmassol> so before your change building any functional test module was failing in maven 3.1+  
16:18 <vmassol> ?  
16:20 <vmassol> maybe it's possible that I have updated to 3.2+ but didn't run a functional tests… strange though since I do that regularly...  
16:20 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:20 <vmassol> anyway thanks for fixing this  
16:20 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
16:21 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:27 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: IRCBot func tesst still fail for me, normal?  
16:29 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/  
16:29 <gdelhumeau> maybe you should pull  
16:31 <Enygma`> vmassol: yes, because of velocity-tools 2.0. I`ve fixed other deprecations but this one does not seem to have an immediate replacement as far as I can see. Need to look better into that. sdumitriu might have a good idea about this since I think I found one of his replies on the velocity-user mailing list on the topic. sdumitriu do you know of any replacement for org.apache.velocity.tools.generic.ListTool in velocity-tools 2.0?  
16:34 <polx> has quit  
16:38 <sdumitriu> Enygma`: There's no replacement, every method that ListTool had is now supported natively, since arrays[] are treated as Lists  
16:42 <evalica> has quit  
16:42 <Enygma`> sdumitriu: will have to look at that tomorrow. Thanks for now. gtg  
16:43 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:45 <vfzevaze> has quit  
16:45 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
16:59 <vmassol> wow  
16:59 <vmassol> "Error occurred during initialization of VM  
16:59 <vmassol> while building only 10 modules or os  
16:59 <vmassol> so  
16:59 <vmassol> and with: MAVEN\_OPTS="-Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=196m"  
17:00 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/3f717e05e2565a5407e9/raw/798e3f85312bf9a41d4a8d91abecbd1fe4221a3a/gistfile1.txt  
17:22 <Denis> has quit  
17:22 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: any idea about the jasmine error in platform for the wbe module?  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: no  
17:28 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: wiki func tests are failing for me in platform, have you fixed them already?  
17:28 <vmassol> xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wiki/xwiki-platform-wiki-test/xwiki-platform-wiki-test-tests  
17:28 <gdelhumeau> yes I did  
17:31 <vmassol> org.openqa.selenium.ElementNotVisibleException: Element is not currently visible and so may not be interacted with  
17:31 <vmassol> in createWikiFromTemplate(org.xwiki.wiki.test.ui.WikiTemplateTest)  Time elapsed: 12.555 sec  <<< ERROR!  
17:32 <mflorea> has quit  
17:52 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: are you up to date?  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> yoy may need to rebuild flamingo too  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> and xwiki-platform-test  
17:53 <vmassol> ok will try that  
17:53 <gdelhumeau> what is jasmine?  
17:53 <vmassol> a framework to exectue unit tests for js  
17:54 <gdelhumeau> does it needs a running xwiki?  
17:54 <vmassol> no  
17:54 <gdelhumeau> so the skin should have no influence?  
17:54 <vmassol> skin no, but js maybe  
17:55 <gdelhumeau> so not any js included by webjars or xar  
17:56 <vmassol> I don' t know
